arguments.name: PATH
arguments.description: Paths may be Python files or directories. For each directory Vulture analyzes all contained *.py files.

options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --exclude
options.description: Comma-separated list of path patterns to ignore (e.g., "*settings.py,docs,*/test_*.py,venv"). Patterns may contain glob wildcards (*, ?, [abc], [!abc]). A PATTERN without glob wildcards is treated as *PATTERN*. Patterns are matched against absolute paths.

options.name: --ignore-decorators
options.description: Comma-separated list of decorators. Functions and classes using these decorators are ignored (e.g., "@app.route,@require_*"). Patterns may contain glob wildcards (*, ?, [abc], [!abc]).

options.name: --ignore-names
options.description: Comma-separated list of names to ignore (e.g., "visit_*,do_*"). Patterns may contain glob wildcards (*, ?, [abc], [!abc]).

options.name: --make-whitelist
options.description: Report unused code in a format that can be added to a whitelist module.

options.name: --min-confidence
options.description: Minimum confidence (between 0 and 100) for code to be reported as unused.

options.name: --sort-by-size
options.description: Sort unused functions and classes by their lines of code.

options.name: --version
options.description: show program's version number and exit
